definition: instrument of the violin family (violin, viola, cello or double bass)/CL:把[ba3]
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: A solo violin carried the theme in “The Fixer”;
sentences.chinese: 在《暗影行動》中，主題曲由小提琴獨奏出。

sentences.english: Victor has a very good voice and plays the violin very well.
sentences.chinese: 維特有一口好嗓音，而且小提琴也拉得很棒。

sentences.english: Bandy legs and fiddle front are objectionable.
sentences.chinese: 彎曲的前腿和提琴前腿都屬於缺陷。

sentences.english: Did you hear about the violist who bragged that he could play 32nd notes?
sentences.chinese: 你聽說有個中提琴手號稱能拉32分音符嗎？

sentences.english: What do you do with a dead violist?
sentences.chinese: 有個中提琴手死了咋辦？

sentences.english: In China, more and more people are concerned about learning and double bass .
sentences.chinese: 在我國，越來越多的人學習和關注低音提琴。

sentences.english: My friend likes playing Ping-pong and playing the violin.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友喜歡打乒乓球和拉小提琴。

sentences.english: He plays the violin better than Mary.
sentences.chinese: 他的小提琴比瑪麗拉得好。

sentences.english: This violinist is as good as Juilliard-trained violinists go.
sentences.chinese: 這個小提琴家和朱麗亞訓練的小提琴家規爲一類。

sentences.english: This violinist is as good as Juilliard-trained violinists go.
sentences.chinese: 這個小提琴家和朱麗亞訓練的小提琴家規爲一類。

sentences.english: He decided to debut with several other violinists.
sentences.chinese: 他決定與其他幾名小提琴手一起首次登臺演出。

sentences.english: The first class that morning was music. He played a tune on the violin.
sentences.chinese: 那天的第一堂課是音樂，他用小提琴演奏了一首曲子。

sentences.english: The young girl violinist outshone all the other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴使所有的競爭者相形見絀。

sentences.english: But he was the super’s boy. He couldn’t even play the fiddle.
sentences.chinese: 他不過是個管理員的兒子，他連小提琴都不會拉。

sentences.english: Er-hu virtuosi can play even the most complex violin pieces with two strings.
sentences.chinese: 二胡大師能用兩根弦拉最複雜的小提琴曲。

sentences.english: At first, Lee-Hom preferred the violin to the piano.
sentences.chinese: 剛開始比起鋼琴力宏更喜歡小提琴。

definition: double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
